ygData.subject: Re: RE : [neat] Speaking about NEAT software packages at GECCO
ygData.msgSnippet: Ho, one more thing about my implementation : here it is an example of a configuration file. As we (maybe) can see, a configuration is just a serialized object

X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=235544548; y=Q4hmAU-_NjMxunBMjAmP3JQIjYPIhFdJ56Vqzy2HRC8XxPGxAg

Ho, one more thing about my implementation : here it is an example of
a con=
figuration file. As we (maybe) can see, a configuration is just a
serialize=
d object in a cool ASCII file format. 

neat.conf(
  eval.op(
   flag.embry=
o.eval.op(
    
target.picture=3D'/users/tao-nosave/devert/EmbryoFlags-expe=
riment/flags/julian-miller.png'
     error.func(square.error.func())
     m=
ax.nb.epochs =3D 256
     nb.chemicals =3D 2
   )
  )

  genotype.template(=

    chromosome.template(
      max.weight =3D 12.0
      is.recurrent =3D =
true
      nb.inputs =3D 9
      nb.outputs =3D 3
    )
  )


  population(=

    size =3D 1000
    elitism.per.specie =3D 1
    survival.ratio.per.spec=
ie =3D 0.1

    similarity.op(
      disjoint.coeff =3D 1.0
      excess.co=
eff =3D 1.0
      mutdiff.coeff =3D 0.2
      #initial.threshold =3D 100.0
=
      size.normalisation =3D true
    )
  )

  #init.op(two.layers.init.op(=
))
  init.op(empty.init.op())



  breed.op(
    copy.coeff =3D 0.00
    mu=
t.coeff =3D 0.85
    cross.coeff =3D 0.15

    cross.op(multipoint.cross.op=
())
    mut.op(
      mixed.mut.op(
        mut.op(coeff =3D 0.800 weight.p=
erturb.mut.op(std.dev =3D 0.05))
        mut.op(coeff =3D 0.100 add.link.mu=
t.op())
        mut.op(coeff =3D 0.100 add.node.mut.op())
        mut.op(co=
eff =3D 0.010 weight.change.mut.op())
        mut.op(coeff =3D 0.045 enable=
.link.mut.op())
        mut.op(coeff =3D 0.045 disable.link.mut.op())      =
      
      )
    )
  )

  term.op(
    term.op.union(
      max.evals.ter=
m.op(max.evals =3D 150000)
      max.fitness.term.op(max.fitness =3D 0.999)=

    )
  )
)
--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Stephen Waits <steve@...> wrote:
=
>
> 
> On Mar 15, 2007, at 12:20 AM, Alexandre Devert wrote:
> 
> > made my=
 own C++ NEAT implementation, I called it
> > TaoNeat. It main cool feature=
s are
> 
> Hello Alexandre,
> 
> Is TaoNeat publicly available?  I too have=
 (mostly) written my own  
> NEAT in C++, but am interested in other implem=
entations.
> 
> Thanks,
> Steve
>
